post.body: Thanks for the inspiration. It was a great way to spend my afternoon lol
I nominate @statravelers for a Shorty Award in #travel - Great links to informative & interesting travel-related articles. <3!
Streusel coffee cake is the best. Merry Christmas :)
I'm going to nominate some of the ppl I follow for Shorty Awards. Nominate me! http://shortyawards.com
New @Slate article analyzes what I've said all along: Journalists are too obsessed w/ decline of their industry - http://tinyurl.com/53v8e2
Danny Elfman's score for "Milk" very similar to that of "Big Fish", but it's okay because both are absolutely gorgeous.
Curled up in a cashmere blanket watching "Matilda" and drinking hot chocolate. :)
I understand the need to be safe on snowy roads. But tonight's weather did NOT warrant going 35 UNDER the speed limit. ARE YOU KIDDING ME.
Best Buy's on-hold music is seriously heavy on the bass. I feel like my left eardrum is going to burst. Tone it down!
Not feeling well today...watching "Flight of the Navigator" on YouTube. Another childhood classic.
Just found out Sarah Jessica Parker was born and raised in Nelsonville, OH. I'll never look at her (or at Nelsonville) the same way again.
Holy crap, I want this White Balance Lens Cap SO MUCH: http://tinyurl.com/5r4o5u
The 4th ep of "Kitchen Confidential" ("French Fight") is officially one of my favorite TV episodes of all time.
I really like my December column for The Courier. Will post a link when it's available online.
My feet hurt like a BITCH right now. That's what I get for nine-hour no-break shifts at work.
Double shifts today again. Plus I'm feeling the beginnings of a cold. Bah, humbug.
Longest night at work ever. Now writing my December column for the Findlay Courier...
"We're Back! A Dinosaur Story", aka one of the most influential movies of my childhood, is now on Hulu - http://tinyurl.com/669k42
Curled up in bed to finish Tom Perrotta's "Little Children", which is way better than I expected.
This was literally the only good part of my day: http://tinyurl.com/5aljk4
Finished first shift @ 2. Lunch @ Panera, coffee @ C. Amici, back to work @ 4. Ugh. Over it.
Watching the fourth season of "The Wire". So so so good.
It's 60 degrees outside. Um?
I'm seriously pissed at Bank of America right now. Also, ohonestly.org just reached 1000 independent hits! Thanks guys!
Well, I want to hang out with my family tomorrow, but I don't know if I can bring myself to see "Bedtime Stories" to do it.
My first tweet, on 09.07.07 - "procrastinating". I think that about sums me up.
Aww, Eartha Kitt died. Amazing woman, amazing voice. I'm going to go listen to LaChiusa's "The Wild Party" now.
Another great Christmas with the Reinekes/Woods. I'm so lucky!
The lights went out for 10 minutes, then came back on. Whew. Anyway, Merry Christmas everyone!!
Electric circuit troubles due to high winds. If the power goes out again, I will be pissed. Once during the holidays is enough.
Bah. Flip MinoHD stopped working again. Talked to tech support; they want me to ship it back for repairs. Baaaah.
The awkward charm of "Newsradio" - http://www.slate.com/id/2204924/
Working on a Christmas playlist for dinner. I wish it would snow instead of this freezing rain nonsense.
Okay, I take it back - the MinoHD isn't working again. I emailed the tech support people. Fingers crossed.
I was just going to tweet how my Flip MinoHD wasn't cooperating, but then it magically started to work, and it's sweet, so, never mind.
I think I'm going to make some hot chocolate, find a nice blanket and finish watching "Iron Man". Happy Christmas Eve eve!
This made my day: "A Charlie Brown Christmas" performed by the cast of "Scrubs" - http://tinyurl.com/yk66ad
Mom and I made three batches of different types of cookies and now I'm exhausted and full.
Check out my Top 10 Pop Culture Discoveries of 2008 at http://ohonestly.org and let me know what you think! Did I miss anything great?
Not feeling well at all today, which sucks because Mom and I are meant to spend the afternoon baking.
